before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"2usc9","text":"We injected the voltage sensor ASAP3 without a soma-targeting signal (AAV5-EF1α-DIO-ASAP3WPRE) following the steps described in Protocol: Intracranial injections of viral vectors in mouse midbrain and striatum. We injected the virus diluted to 2.4E+12 vg/ml in the midbrain (1 μL per site) of heterozygous DAT-IRES-Cre mice.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":128,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":128,"length":81}],"data":{}},{"key":"7it1v","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cos4s","text":"The coordinates used by us for targeting the midbrain were as follows:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4thct","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a0j8","text":"Ventral tegmental area (VTA) (AP = -3.1 mm, ML = ± 0.5 mm, DV = -4.4 mm)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfrt3","text":"Substancia nigra pars compacta (SNc) (AP = -3.5 mm, ML = ± 1.2 mm , DV = -4.0 mm)","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a16n","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lcuq","text":"Animals were maintained for at least three weeks following surgery to allow virus expression in the midbrain. We then prepare ex vivo brain slices by performing steps 1 to 11 from Protocol: Fast-scan cyclic voltammetry to assess dopamine release in ex vivo mouse brain slices. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":126,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":161,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":180,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":180,"length":95}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3A1EA0C29BA0465EBB8A76AA2D64F6D3","url":"http://10.17504/protocols.io.36wgqdyz3vk5/v1"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"8AFC1AA50F90431BBBD5661BE5A1F0AA","url":"http://10.17504/protocols.io.36wgqdbmxvk5/v1"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e93t3","text":"This protocol describes how to perform wide-field imaging of voltage sensors using high frame rates (660 Hz minimum every 2.5 minutes) in mouse midbrain using ex vivo brain slices. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":159,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"76ohq","text":"This protocol uses the ASAP3 voltage sensor (AAV5-EF1α-DIO-ASAP3WPRE) kindly donated by the Lin lab.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":92,"length":7}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"07D27043DCA211EF9B2D0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://linlab.stanford.edu"}}}}
ethics_statement: {"blocks":[{"key":"69nsa","text":"All procedures on animals were conducted in accordance with the Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act 1986 (United Kingdom), approved by an Animal Welfare and Ethical Review Board at the University of Oxford, under the authority of Licenses from the Home Office (UK).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

(2024) An axonal brake on striatal dopamine output by cholinergic interneurons, bioRxiv","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":71}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":20,"length":71}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0F4A8655E5244FA5A9B7564829ED053C","url":"https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2024.02.17.580796v1"}}}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"7q8gi","text":"Equipment:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90ikn","text":"Olympus BX51Wl microscope equipped with a OptoLED Lite system (CAIRN Research);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4op5p","text":"iXon EMCCD Camera (ANDOR);","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej0gn","text":"x40/0.8 NA water-objective (Olympus UK)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dfjg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bdac","text":"Virus:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"97vs8","text":"AAV5-EF1α-DIO-ASAP3WPRE (ASAP3) from Stanford Gene Vector and Virus Core. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvkhg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dg2d","text":"Software:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgg7a","text":"Micro-Manager v1.4","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh2v3","text":"PClamp ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cprl3","text":"Matlab vR2019b ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e49v6","text":"Fiji v1.5","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40nt9","text":"Using a x40/0.8 NA water-objective (Olympus UK), position the stimulating electrode on the surface of the brain slice and centre it in the field of view.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9pq2f","text":"The following steps were performed in MATLAB vR2019b and Fiji v1.5.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16rt8","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cfp5d","text":"Extract ﬂuorescence intensity from the region of interest (~5 µm * 5 µm).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1j43d","text":"Apply electrical stimulus pulses singly and in trains (4 pulses, 50 Hz) using PClamp.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3mf8p","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g77d","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5epfo","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f7083","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5j2hg","text":"The order of single and train stimulations was alternated and equally distributed and data were collected in duplicate before and after a change in extracellular experimental condition. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bi0vh","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dmg2t","text":"Observations were time-locked to the deflection.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avkvb","text":"Bleach-correct the ASAP3 transients by ﬁtting an exponential curve function.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8vbk1","text":"Expressed data as ΔF/F where F is the ﬁtted curve.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ftae","text":"Change the exposure time to reach a frame rate of around 600 Hz every 2.5 min using Micro-Manager v1.4.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"de2rn","text":"Record changes in fluorescence intensity using PClamp. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Wide-field imaging of voltage sensors expressed in ex vivo mouse brain slices
